main_definition: Medicare is an insurance program primarily designed to cover healthcare costs for individuals aged 65 or older, as well as some younger people with disabilities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A U.S. government program providing health care coverage to seniors and certain disabled individuals
meanings_and_examples.example: Medicare Part A covers hospital insurance for elderly Americans who are 65 or older.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process of subsidizing medical expenses through various means, including government programs
meanings_and_examples.example: In some countries, medicare is funded by taxes and provides coverage for a portion of citizens' healthcare costs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used to describe the provision or support of medical services by an insurance company or another third party
meanings_and_examples.example: The hospital was not part of any medicare program, so patients had to pay for their treatments out-of-pocket.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A payment plan set up between a patient and their healthcare provider to manage medical expenses over time
meanings_and_examples.example: My doctor recommended that I set up a medicare payment plan with the clinic so that my bills would be more manageable.
